headline.print_headline: Before Election, Old Rivalries Endanger Libya’s Dream of a Fresh Start
headline.main: Before Vote, Old Rivalries Threaten Fresh Start in Libya

docs.snippet: Many Libyans still hope that the election of a new national congress will offer a more peaceful way to resolve differences....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Many people in Libya, which has been riven for decades by recurring battles among regions and tribes vying for a cut of the oil wealth and other privileges, fear new neglect under a more democratic Libya.

byline.contributor: Suleiman Ali Zway contributed reporting from Benghazi.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many Libyans still hope that the election of a new national congress will offer a more peaceful way to resolve differences.

headline.print_headline: Obama Urges Voters to Look Ahead on Economy
headline.seo: Obama Urges Voters to Look Ahead on Economy
headline.main: Obama Urges Voters to Look Ahead on Economy

docs.snippet: After the release of the third straight anemic jobs report, the president asked that voters take the long view when assessing the nation’s economic fortunes....
docs.abstract: President Obama concedes that the economy is not generating enough jobs, that the recovery is not taking hold quickly enough, and that too many Americans lack basic financial security, after the release of the third straight anemic employment report; with few signs that the labor market will strengthen much before Election Day, he is honing a vocabulary to talk about the listless economy, one that emphasizes a glass-half-full approach to the numbers and an appeal to voters to take the long view.
docs.lead_paragraph: After the release of the third straight anemic jobs report, the president asked that voters take the long view when assessing the nation’s economic fortunes.

headline.print_headline: 2 Bronx Children Die After Their Mother Turns on Gas and Slits Her Wrists
headline.seo: 2 Bronx Children Die After Mother Turns on Gas And Cuts Wrists
headline.main: 2 Bronx Children Die After Their Mother Turns on Gas and Slits Her Wrists

docs.snippet: It was unclear whether the children succumbed to gas asphyxiation — lack of oxygen — or died from a lethal dose of some kind of poison, a police official said....
docs.abstract: New York City police officers responding to a call about a gas leak find Lisette Bamenga and her two children, 5-year-old Trevor Noel Jr and 4-month-old Lillian Noel, unconscious in the kitchen of their Bronx apartment; both children die and the mother is in stable condition in what police believe was a suicide attempt by Barnenga; father of the deceased children is New York Police Officer Trevor Noel.

byline.original: By WENDY RUDERMAN and COLIN MOYNIHAN

docs.lead_paragraph: It was unclear whether the children succumbed to gas asphyxiation — lack of oxygen — or died from a lethal dose of some kind of poison, a police official said.

docs.snippet: The Brits are in an uproar over the rate-fixing scandal. What will it take to get the same response here?...
docs.abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column contends that Great Britain's Libor scandal is shocking in the level of brazen collusion it involved, even in light of other large-scale frauds uncovered following the financial crisis; notes that the scandal has provoked little more than a shrug in America, where people seem to have become inured to high financial crimes.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Brits are in an uproar over the rate-fixing scandal. What will it take to get the same response here?

headline.print_headline: Nod to Progress Endangers An Old Clock
headline.seo: Cellphone Proposal for Southampton Clock Tower Provokes Dispute
headline.main: Nod to Progress Endangers an Old Clock

docs.snippet: The First Presbyterian Church wants to install cellphone antennas inside its clock tower, a beloved Southampton landmark, provoking fierce opposition among residents....
docs.abstract: First Presbyterian Church in Southampton, NY, wants to install cellphone antennas inside its clock tower; plans for the beloved 169-year-old landmark are provoking fierce opposition among residents.
docs.lead_paragraph: The First Presbyterian Church wants to install cellphone antennas inside its clock tower, a beloved Southampton landmark, provoking fierce opposition among residents.

headline.seo: 76ers Use Amnesty Clause and Waive Elton Brand
headline.main: 76ers Use Amnesty Clause and Waive Brand

docs.snippet: The Philadelphia 76ers have used the amnesty clause on the veteran forward Elton Brand and will get about $18 million in salary cap relief for next season....
docs.abstract: Philadelphia 76ers use amnesty clause on the veteran forward Elton Brand and will get about $18 million in salary cap relief for 2012-13 season.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Philadelphia 76ers have used the amnesty clause on the veteran forward Elton Brand and will get about $18 million in salary cap relief for next season.

headline.print_headline: Howard Back From Injury, But Phillies Lose to Braves
headline.seo: Braves Spoil Ryan Howard’s Season Debut for the Phillies
headline.main: Howard Back From Injury, but Phillies Lose to Braves

docs.snippet: Brian McCann hit a grand slam, Tim Hudson tossed four-hit ball over seven innings and the Atlanta Braves beat host Philadelphia to spoil Ryan Howard’s season debut Friday night....
docs.abstract: MLB Roundup; Atlanta Braves beat the Philadelphia Phillies, 5-0; other results and news noted.
docs.lead_paragraph: Brian McCann hit a grand slam, Tim Hudson tossed four-hit ball over seven innings and the Atlanta Braves beat host Philadelphia to spoil Ryan Howard’s season debut Friday night.

headline.print_headline: Shipshape at the Wharf in Trondheim
headline.seo: Shipshape at the Wharf in Trondheim
headline.main: Shipshape at the Wharf in Trondheim

docs.snippet: From the upper deck of a Norwegian ferry, the precision of a trio of forklift drivers is a sight to behold....
docs.abstract: Verlyn Klinkenborg Editorial Observer praises the graceful precision of forklift operators who load cargo in the port city of Trondheim, Norway.
docs.lead_paragraph: From the upper deck of a Norwegian ferry, the precision of a trio of forklift drivers is a sight to behold.

headline.print_headline: On Special Education, Spurned Teacher Is Vindicated
headline.seo: State Backs Up Accusation by Harris Lirtzman, Bronx Teacher, on Special Education - Gotham
headline.main: On Special Education, Spurned Teacher Is Vindicated

docs.snippet: When Harris Lirtzman warned his principal that their Bronx school was violating the rights of special needs students, he lost his job, but the State Education Department now says he was right....
docs.abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column on Bronx school teacher Harris Lirtzman, who lost his job after warning his principal that chool was violating the rights of special needs students; New York State Education Department investigated the charges, ultimately vindicating Lirtzman, but he had already chosen to retire.
docs.lead_paragraph: When Harris Lirtzman warned his principal that their Bronx school was violating the rights of special needs students, he lost his job, but the State Education Department now says he was right.
